Reviews.Title: “Staff Elevates Overall Rating”
Reviews.Author: Rennoc91
Reviews.Content: First visit to Branson, staying three nights, Sept. 5-6-7, 2012. Requested quiet room, which we received. Problem with key not opening door. Staff immediately switched us to an adjacent room, with apologies. Fortunately we were on the east side of building, as temps soared to 95+ during our stay and our room escaped the blazing afternoon sun. Severe storm on 2nd afternoon which knocked out power to hotel for about two hours. Discovered all surrounding business had power. Staff advised B/W is serviced by a different power company. Nice breakfast; nothing outstanding, but sufficient. Older, well used property. Nothing special about rooms, but A/C was VERY good. Carpet badly worn, but clean. Bath/shower controls very touchy to adjustment. A sink faucet that extends out over the bowl would be a great help! We had double beds, One slept fine, but my mattress "sloped" to nightstand side, enough to be annoying after one night. Hotel is handy to Starlite Theatre, which is what we were most interested in. Steakhouse also adjacent, with decent food. Would definitely stay here again for two reasons: (1) Convenience to what we are interested in, but (2) mostly because ALL hotel employees were exceptionally friendly and helpful, something you find less and less these days.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at Center Pointe for years”
Reviews.Author: Frances M
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the staff are friendly, the room includes breakfast with a complete choice of breakfast items. It is a GREAT CHOICE FOR FAMILIES.. Our family uses both the indoor and outdoor pools..You do not hear your neighbors and the beds give you a nice restful sleep. The property is cleaned and swept every morning so there is no trash or cigerette butts running down the property.. My only regret in the nice little park is gone this year. Due to the leap year tornado, its a parking area now. :( miss the beautiful tree and picnic tables.. last few years most sit there in the morning listen to the birds before the busy day...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CarlQuincy_il
Reviews.Content: Bugs in the room, mushy beds, hair dryer did not function well, there were broken machines in fitness room, won't be staying there again. It was quite inconveniet getting around there construction getting to the inside pool.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE, OUR HOME AWAY FROM HOME!”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl77
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews on hotels when getting ready to book a hotel and after reading numerous reviews of different hotels in Branson, MO. I felt the best reviews were with Best Western Center Pointe Inn. It was everything we expected and more! The staff was the friendliest we have ever encountered and so accomadating! Our room was nice and clean, nice carpets. Bedding looked crisp and smelled fresh. Beds were comfrotable. Very homey atmosphere. Loved the fact we had a micro and fridge for left overs and cold drinks. Loved the open Bible to Psalms 23 and sorry if it offends some but we loved it and the card was lying on the Bible said "To Our Guest" The Stranger within our gates. Because we care about our guests, we pray that God will grant you peace and rest while you are under our roof. May this room and hotel be your "second" home and may thsoe you love be near you in your thoughts and dreams. May your stay with us be an enjoyable one and may you feel as comfortable as if you were in your own home! Amen! We loved that! We have never seen that in any hotel and we have stayed in many! So unique! Bob Williams and Staff, you deserve a 10 star rating! God Bless You for making us feel right at home in our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with Teens”
Reviews.Author: livewireOklahoma
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating. From the front desk to the maintenance people, all were friendly and willing to help in any way. The teens slept in late but were not disturbed by the maids except to ask if they needed new towels, etc. The location was perfect for our teens to walk to various activites. A restaurant is located right next door. A good and filling breakfast was available every morning until 9:30am. Tickets to the various shows were available at a discount right there in the gift shop. The staff all greeted us with a smile. I rented 3 rooms for 7 days and the whole trip was made pleasant by the friendly staff. We saw a lot of what Branson has to offer from this convenient location. I highly recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: hoosierclone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights on a short trip to Branson. Nothing over the top either way, clean, decent nights sleep, far enough off the road to not have the road noise from the strip, Right in the center of town, with in walking distance to alot although we did not take advantage of this becasue ti was so hot during our stay. nice pools both on the small side though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pjmitchem
Reviews.Content: We stayed June 9th. Rooms were clean & comfortable beds & pillows. Enjoyed the outdoor pool & hot tub

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KC4444
Reviews.Content: Our group consisted of grandparents, parents and kids. This hotel worked for all of our needs. We liked staying in the main building that has both inside and outside doors for accessing your room. The inside doors made it convenience to go to the inside pool & hot tub as well as breakfast area in the morning. Breakfast had a nice variety for anyone tastes. The breakfast area also has a picture window of the indoor pool area. This was a good place to sit inside the air condition while the kids where in the pool and a – also a little less noisy for talking. The out door pool & jacuzzi was also nice – though the kids preferred it in the evening when the sun went down. The location is very easy to find – once you see the Titanic Ship out front. This is also located by the corner stop light which made it easy getting around. Though the hotel is on the center strip it sit back behind a steak house so there is no road noise.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait until they rebuild”
Reviews.Author: stubbornme
Reviews.Content: I had a res there for this weekend,unfortunately they were hit by the tornado. Corporate called me the day after it happened and guided me through my options. A few days later the manager called just to make sure I was taken care of. Great customer service in what I'm sure was a tough time for that mgr

Reviews.Title: “Ants”
Reviews.Author: Allan K
Reviews.Content: This hotel ad. says smoking or non smoking rooms,got there and they said only non smoking rooms,in room phone didnt work so we had 5 people in our room trying to figure it out for over an hour,they put us in a different room way in the back and we found out the room had ants all over .Tried to get a refund,but they said they couldnt do it,We will never stay at best western again,And i will tell as many people as i can about them.Also no wifi .

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CathyG S
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice & clean. Very good service @ the front desk to set up show tickets. Currenly the registration-office has construction in front. The breakfast room, pool, hot tub & fitness room were in a different building than our room. This would have been OK in the summer, but we were there in the winter & had to go outside in the rain. Very good breakfast choices with the hot food included.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for your Branson Visit.”
Reviews.Author: maryloubrownn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and felt it was a clean, safe and centrally located to easily get to our shows. A very good deal for the money. We were on the ground floor and the noise was not a problem as it sits back far enough from the main street, eating places and 2 of our shows we just had to walk across the street for, not even getting in our car. parking was also always close to our room.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN, CLEAN, & CLEAN!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laracegirl
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cleanest hotels we have ever stayed in. It didn't have that hotel smell that most hotels have. We stayed in the indoor building, our room had an outside door and an inside door which was inside corridors. The breakfast was very very good, we had eggs, sausage, donuts and biscuits & gravy, oh an make your own waffles every morning. We had clean towels every night when we came back in. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, OK prices, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AzBoo
Reviews.Content: This place is in a very good central location. The rooms were clean and average. The price seemed a bit high for the off season. The breakfast was typical hot buffet hotel style breakfast with little flavor. There are so many other places to choose from in Branson so I doubt if I would stay here again. Nothing inherently wrong with the place. Just average with an above average price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, First Stay in Branson.”
Reviews.Author: FatherDaughterTravel
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing stay. The pool was great and looked beautiful at night after a long day in Branson. Was right behind The Titanic Museum, and that was the main attraction, I and my parents wanted to go to. We stayed three or four days in Branson. The breakfast was great, but a little crowded. And the pool was sometimes crowded. Overall, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: ghstfalcon
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the second floor. One was great, but the other one smelled so bad of mildew due to what looked to be water damage on the ceiling. Other than that the rooms are nice and the staff is nice. Don't leave your car doors or trunk open even to walk around your vehicle. The parking lot is loaded with stray cats that will run to your vehicle and sneak inside looking for food even though we saw piles of cat food being dumped out for them. They really were a pain everytime we went to the car. We watched them get in someones van at one point.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but not ideal”
Reviews.Author: kristielynn
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel blind as a special on Hotwire. It was supposed to be a 3 star hotel, and previously when we had booked blind we ended up at the Radisson, so were a bit surprised it ended up as the Best Western (most other sites rate this one at 2.5 stars, not 3). The room was fine for our needs, as we were only staying one night. The room was clean, and I appreciated that it had a mini fridge and microwave (especially useful when you're traveling with a small child). On the negative side, it is a motel and you could hear a lot more noise at night between the cars outside and the people walking around. The layout of the rooms and the parking lot was also not well planned and made it a hassle to get to our room. Additionally, I think it also made it confusing to other guests as on two occassions we had people come knocking on our door by mistake, looking for the room above us. Not a big deal, except one of those times happened to be shortly before midnight. Other than that, the location is right on the strip, which is good for proximitiy to attractions, but not for avoiding traffic. To end on a positive note, the continental breakfast was good and offered a wide selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, great people!”
Reviews.Author: Richard S
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this Best Western and it has always been a pleasant experience, from the friendliness and ease of check in to the day we leave. It is clean, very well maintained and the entire staff is truly friendly and helpful. The only glitch on the trip was entirely my fault, I had left my Kindel in the room when we checked out and didn't miss it for almost a week. When I called the motel they told me they had it at the desk and would mail it out by Priority Mail, in fact the Kindel beat us home. The location is very conveniently located and has everything you need from a Walgreens across the street to a great steak house on the property, plus it is in easy walking distance to shows and other entertainment. There is absolutely no doubt where we will stay the next time we are in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Gail S
Reviews.Content: This was a great location; the staff was great and very welcoming. Our room was clean. The pool was great and also the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: Kenny B
Reviews.Content: Another hotel in Branson lost my group reservation of 6 rooms the week of our stay. I was in a panic. I called several hotels in the area, but nothing was coming about. I then called Best Western Center Pointe. I was BLOWN AWAY by their hospitality. Not only did they have rooms available for my youth group, but also made it where all the guys rooms adjoined to each other, and did the same for the girls rooms. The people at BW Center Pointe, also gave us the room at the same price I was going to pay at the other hotel. Very nice and courteous, and the breakfast was AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Money I Paid.”
Reviews.Author: binupappachan
Reviews.Content: This was a day stay and it was worth the money I paid to stay here. I liked there clean pool & hot tub. They had more varities for beakfast compared to other hotels in this price range and star value. Rooms where also okay. Checking in and out was the easiest ever. Most of all the location, almost all the favourite visiting places are couple of mile around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “convient to everything”
Reviews.Author: steve555Austin
Reviews.Content: we booked due to the location and the "best western Brand". This hotel was located right across from the Clay Cooper Theater. It was also close to many other attractions, which we were able to walk. The room, staff, pool, breakfast, was up good. The rooms across from the steak house had some noise problems, I would recommend a room away from this area. They had a ticket agent office for booking shows, which was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay @ Center Pointe”
Reviews.Author: 460Traci
Reviews.Content: I always stay @ BW Center Point Inn. I never had any problems at all staying there. I love the staff & others who work there. I know them who work there. It's a good place to stay & in a good location. Traci Wise

Reviews.Title: “Good Location nice Outdoor pool and tub”
Reviews.Author: Me M
Reviews.Content: Typical Best Western with the rooms accessed from the outside. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The pool was very clean and a nice sun trap. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela V
Reviews.Content: My sister-in-law and I stayed 2 nights at the Center Pointe Inn in Branson and had a great stay. The room was clean, comfortable and even had a refrigerator and microwave. The breakfast was very good as well. The check in and check out was the fastest I have experienced in my years of traveling. I will recommend this facility to everyone who is planning a trip to Branson. Pam Villanueva

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean Branson Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoHOGSGo1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times and it is consistently the best experience for our Branson trips with the kids. There are lots of hotels in Branson, but you can not always count on a good, clean experience. This hotel has never let us down. Spacious rooms, 2 pools (1 indoor/1 outdoor). Restaurant located in parking lot, Montana Mike's, great food. Hotel is very accessible to all the "fast routes" in Branson. I always ask for an interior room when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Well taken care of”
Reviews.Author: Ben A
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Center Pointe in Branson, Mo. treated our reunion of sailors from the 1960s with exceptional care. The hospitality room we ordered was set up and maintained so that our time together was the best. The hotel even went to the internet and researched our ship and put together a binder of photos that we didn't know existed. The staff came by on a regular basis asking if there was anything we needed. This was our 2nd reunion in Branson and was so much better than the first one. If we hold the next one in Branson, we will hold it at the BW Center Pointe.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room we stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki951
Reviews.Content: Our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so we waited. A couple walked in after us, didn't have a reservation and they got a room right away. When we arrived to our room, there was water stains on the ceiling, wall paper off walls and the worst was the bathroom stunk of urine. I went back down to ask for a cleaner room and the lady said all the rooms are same. When my mom woke in the middle of the night and had to use her emergency inhaler, we packed up and check out and went to the Fairfield. This is the worst hotel I have ever been in.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK. I would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay2104
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just fine for our trip. We arrived late and were tired but the staff at the front counter were awesome. They made us smile after a long trip. They were very helpful in explaining where everything was located and gave us information for shopping/shows. The rooms were OK. Nothing special. The bathroom/closet area was super duper small for 4 ladies getting ready.... The beds were okay. The hotel grounds outdoors were a little messy.. (trash needed to be picked up, trees needed to be trimmed). The pool looked very nice but we didn't have time to take advantage of it. The breakfast in the morning was very good. Cereal, Eggs, Sausage, Yogurt, Fruit, Muffins, Water, Juice, Milk. This hotel was a nice distance from shopping, shows, eating, etc. The main reasons I would would go back to this hotel would be the front counter staff, location and the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 3 times”
Reviews.Author: becky6147
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 times now and love it. It is adjacent to The Titanic Exhibit and Montana Mike's Steakhouse is on the property too. The rooms are nice and makes you feel welcomed. Very clean and the decor is great. I would recommend staying here if you get the chance to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute best motel in Branson”
Reviews.Author: royem
Reviews.Content: This motel was fantastic !!! When you reserve a room on line , you are really gambling that you will not have an unpleasant surprise when you get there . When we got to the Best Western , it was clean , the staff were extremely friendly and the free morning breakfast was outstanding , not just cereal or a roll . They had eggs ,sausage , waffles , etc. All the comforts of home and the location was right in the center of all the shows ,etc. The price was very reasonable . We will definitely being using the Best Western again when we come back to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location but too much traffic”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bum_Geezer
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and fast. Room was standard hotel fare. Since we were in the middle of a heat wave, we were glad the air conditioner was working. The downside was that the direction of the air was fixed and at night it blew right on our heads when we went to bed. There were lots of families there and the kids really enjoyed the two swimming pools. Some of the rooms had parking directly in front of their doors (and on a flat surface). The rest of the rooms were perched on the side of a small hill and parking was very tight. The Branson traffice on 76 lived up to expectation. It didn't take us long to learn the back roads to get in and out of the parking lot. We were within walking distance of several resturants and attractions but due to the heat we elected to drive most of the time. The biggest issue we had was with the elevator. There was a very large jerk combined with a bang and vibration when the elevator was going up. When we looked for a certificate of operation, we could not find it. From that point on we used the stairs. While there is nothing wrong with this hotel, next time we will stay "off the beaten path" to avoid the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Minor Pros and Major Cons”
Reviews.Author: kcmomofbrandon
Reviews.Content: Hello, in all my reviews I list pros and cons, so I will start with the pros. The rooms were very clean, big and air conditioners (in 100+ weather) worked perfectly. The beds were super comfortable with big, fluffy pillows. There was one front desk lady that was very nice--Sue. The indoor pool was nice, as the outdoor one would fit about 10 people. We did not eat the breakfast bar, as we got there at 8:30 am the first morning and there were people 3 deep througout the whole bar--totally not worth it to me. As far as the cons, the major one was that I got the room on a website called _riceline.com--where you name your own price. However, being that I was one of those customers and felt a certain degree of "second class citizenship", as I checked in I asked Michael if he had any king beds available because I had a 5 year old that fell out of bed and brought only one bed rail with me. He said "not for your whole stay". Why didn't they offer the king size bed room for the time it WAS available and I would happily move once it became full? My room was at the very END of the elevators too--the very last one on the 3rd floor. As I walked away he was smirking and mumbling something under his breath to the other lady. I don't think he should be in customer service. We get to the room and as I said the rooms were very nice, (although there was no soap to put beside your sink--only the dispenser in the shower--odd) but the door was out of alignment with about 1/2 inch showing through the bottom and light coming through the whole door. I called the front desk and maintenance was there in less than 5 minutes. I asked them if that was normal (their names were Richard and Tommy, I think) . They said it was warped and all the weather stripping was off of it. They called the front desk, told them to NOT assign the room until they could fix it, switched my room and went to get the key for me. They were so nice and went out of their way. Another con was the maid service. I had the privacy thing in the door by mistake once , so that was my fault. The next day, we left the room at 9:30 am and returned to swim at 2:00 pm. The towels had been taken from the room before the actual cleaning, but it hadn't been cleaned yet. They didn't clean the room (I was watching from the indoor pool) until after 4 pm! It's a small thing, but they also didn't leave drinking cups when we ran out, but we used the coffee cups. I guess all said and done, I was happy to have a clean, cold room at a great price through _riceline.com, but if given a choice I would not choose to stay at this hotel again based on customer service (front desk except for Sue) and maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, decent value”
Reviews.Author: zajabor
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel is at a nice location - on the strip close to everything and yet easy to get out. The rates are reasonable, rooms decent. The continental breakfast was very good. Service was friendly. Cons: Housekeeping was very poor- did not show up even once during our 3 night stay. Hopefully this isn't a norm.

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: PDawson_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western because that was one of the few places with a vacancy over July 4th. It was clean enough and the service was good. The breakfast was not great but found enough to eat. Would stay again if that was the only place available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: KC4444
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the main building with the indoor pool/hot tub and the breakfast room. Our rooms were located on the 1st floor which had both an exterior and interior doors making it very convenient. Both the outdoor & indoor pools are clean and had pool towels available. The kids like that the pool hours were from 8am to midnight. The indoor pool was warm if you weren’t swimming - so with the breakfast room next to the pool made it a great place to watch the kids in air condition. Breakfast consisted of scrambled & hard boiled eggs, sausage patties, potatoes, biscuits and gravy. There was also apples, oranges, fruit cups, yogurt, toast, bagels, cinnamon rolls and excellent donuts. The have coffee all day long and but at breakfast juices, hot chocolate and hot and several cold cereals. The bed was very comfortable and had 4 fluffy pillows for each bed. We especially liked the separate sink area with a full length mirror across from the sink mirror and a swivel magnify mirror for getting ready. The hotel is right by the Titanic museum which helped to locate on the strip. We would definite stay here again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Badger541
Reviews.Content: Great location,great staff who were more than helpfull especially getting us good seats at the shows we booked. Great for getting around on foot (not that anyone else was walking) Montana Mikes on site excellent food. All in all a great stay

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: cookieman123
Reviews.Content: best place in branson to stay very friendly staff good food very clean rooms .good pool too.They go out of way for you they booked our show tickets for us with real good seats we will stay there every time we go to branson.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest place to stay in Branson”
Reviews.Author: MaryEllenNew
Reviews.Content: Just before we left for Branson my daughter hurt her knee. I canned the hotel and asked if we could have a main floor room. When we arrived we got a great room. Also, the hotel has elevators that make moving in a breeze. The breakfast is a BREAKFAST, not a Contential breakfast. We had such a pleasant time. In fact we are going back and staying here in May.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Underrated - A Pleasant Surprise and a Great Deal. Ideal for Families!”
Reviews.Author: MidwesternMomof5
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an impromptu road trip to Branson for Spring Break. My husband and I traveled with our 5 children ages 2-12. We'd never visited the area before, so had no idea of where to stay. Although the reviews for this hotel were average, it was one of the few we contacted that could accommodate our family in one room without any "extra" charges. Plus, it was located smack dab in the middle of the strip. So...we took a gamble and booked our stay. We were happily surprised at every turn with this hotel. Our room had two Queen beds and a pull out couch and there was still plenty of room for our pack & play crib. There was a nice amount of space overall - we never felt like we were on top of one another which is rare for a family of our size. There was generous closet space and two large dressers which held all of our clothes for the week. There was a separate sink and make-up area outside of the bathroom which was nice when it came time to get ready in the morning. The bathroom was standard but clean and large enough. There is a soap and shampoo dispenser in the shower in lieu of travel sized bottles - so be advised if you are particular about your products. There was a roomy dorm-sized fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker as well which was great for us with the kids. Everything in the room was clean and well cared for. The decor was current and the beds/bedding were very comfortable. There's no pay per view, but a nice array of family friendly channels on the flat screen TV. It was nice to not have to worry that one of our kids would end up seeing something inappropriate as has happened at other hotels. The laundry facilities and gym were basic, but sufficient for our needs. The Best Western is not a 5 star resort, but I'd rank it far above the average chain hotel. A sweet touch was the bible on the desk open to Psalm 23 with a note from the hotel wishing us a nice stay. The staff was friendly and warm, right down to housekeeping. Our room was right across from the elevator, but we were not disturbed by a single noise - the hotel seems to be very soundproof ...another nice surprise. The pool and hot tub were clean, good-sized and warm! The daily free breakfast was always hot and well stocked with a solid variety of items to choose from. There were always at least 2 employees there making sure the breakfast area was immaculate and fresh. We never felt the need to go anywhere else for our morning meal and all 5 of our kids found things they liked. Only a couple of tips: Make sure to request a room in the main building, otherwise you will have to walk outside to get to the pool and breakfast area. I'd also suggest getting a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor so you have an interior door and not one facing the parking lot. We had to walk through the pool area to get to the breakfast room, which didn't bother us, but might be an issue for some. Location-wise, we were in the heart of the strip. The Titanic Museum (awesome!) is right next door. The adjacent restaurant, Montana Mike's provided a great meal at reasonable prices in a family atmosphere. There is a Walgreens almost across the street if you need anything during your stay. We traveled in a 38' RV and had no problems getting in and out of the hotel parking lot. We would definitely stay here again because we know we're guaranteed a great stay! I'd highly recommend this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cruise,J.D.
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice before. Not much has changed since my last review. The hotel offers an excellent location, great indoor pool and hot tub, and a nice price. The rooms are starting to show some wear, and I did find one bug in the room, but I'm going to chalk that up to an anomaly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: DrivingAgain
Reviews.Content: We had twelve family members in Branson. Right on the strip and close to a major intersection so you didn't get stuck in Branson traffic. Very accommodating to our group.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent economy motel”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed for thanksgiving holiday. Staff honored our request on reservation for main building room. The main building has indoor corridors and is in the building where the indoor pool is and the breakfast room so is nice when going back and forth without going outside. Motel is on the strip but near the back routes so easy to get around for a strip motel. Room was clean and beds were comfy. This is not a Marriott or Hilton but is a great value for clean comfy room. Room has mini fridge and microwave. The extended continental was good. Biscuits and gravy, waffles, bagels, hard boiled eggs, juice, yogurt, and assorted fruit and cereals. No meat but plenty for an extended continental. The staff was very good about keeping it clean and stocked. Breakfast room is small for the size of motel but indoor pool is next to it and also has tables. Indoor pool and hot tub were very nice. Tub was 104 degrees and pool was comfortable. Kids enjoyed it. The gym was lacking but sauna was nice. Wireless was free but weak. The 3G on iPad was faster.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: harvickfan-29
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. We had been traveling for 3 days and the other hotels were not very good so we were happy to stay at such a nice one. Check-in\out was smooth, though the front desk people should smile more. They were professional, but not as friendly as they could be. We liked the pool, the breakfast, and the guest laundry. The hotel had easy access to so many different activities, esp. the Titanic museum, which was awesome! I was happy to see the extra towels in the rooms, since most hotels put in only 2-3. They are trying to go green so they installed a dispenser for soap and body wash. I would like to have the option of a bar of soap but not a major complaint. My biggest complaint was the bed. There was something wrong with either the mattress or boxspring, or both. When you sat on the edge of the bed, it would sink so low, it felt like you would fall off. I slept more in the middle of the bed, so I wouldn't fall off. Other than that, we all liked the hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, clean hotel, friendly staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: rej63
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, no problems. Indoor and outdoor pools and spas. breakfast had all the usual choices plus biscuit and gravy, and waffles. Doors open to outside. Close to all attractions. Easy to use "Blue" route for easily getting around town. Great shopping close by. Nicely decorated rooms, beds could be upgraded.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but good location.”
Reviews.Author: KalenaJeanne
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Best Western Center Pointe Inn. It was mediocre in appearance and size of rooms. It was in the center of town. But the traffic is so bad along highway 76 that it is a slow drive to anywhere unless you learn the back roads. The rooms were clean and service was prompt. We heard very little outside noise nor noise from other units. They had a continental breakfast; cereal, milk, a little fruit, packages of gravy you mixed with water, hard boiled eggs you could reheat. We ate breakfast out. There is a restaurant next door (Montana Jack's Steakhouse)that serves lunch, dinner. We had a pretty good meal there. There are multitudes of other places to stay that are away from central Branson. We just didn't know that when we booked this trip as none of us had been before. Beware crossing the streets on Hwy 76. For whatever reason crosswalks are few and far between.

Reviews.Title: “Good, quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beaches12345
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in July, 2010. It was very crowded, but also very quiet. We couldn't hear any of the neighbors, no doors slamming...Our room was on the bottom floor, had an inside door to the interior hall and an outside door to the side parking lot. That was pretty convenient. I would suggest that you NOT let them give you rooms 127 or 128 because these 2 rooms are right by the indoor pool and everyone is going in and out the door right in front of these rooms. We were in room 134 about 1/2 way down the hall and it was fine. The staff was great, room was very clean. We only used the breakfast about 2 times because it was so crowded. The pools on their site look HUGE, but, in reality they were pretty small and always crowded. They must have used a special camera to take pictures of the pools because they looked larger on the website than in person. One day the indoor pool was closed and the outdoor was super crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: RichNAZ
Reviews.Content: I came to Branson for business but the hotel close to anything I wanted to do. The hotel is centrally located in the entertainment area of Branson, next door to the Titanic Museum and across the street from the Clay Cooper Theatre. From the street view, the hotel appears to be an average hotel.. Once inside I found upgraded furnishings, large clean room, firendly and helpful staff and two pools (one inside, one outside). The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but there is a full service restraurant and lounge which shares a parking lot with the hotel. The hotel is a great fit for families traveling with children, offering a game room, two pools, parking close to the rooms and a complimentary breakfast. For the business traveler, I enjoyed having access to a fitness center, multiple food and beverage opportunities nearby, free internet access, complimentary breakfast and plenty of parking. When returning to Branson with my family or again for business I look forward to staying at the Best Western Center Pointe Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I ever expected”
Reviews.Author: gorillas5
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a first floor room, with outside access, which was really helpful for my aunt, who is disabled. We had two sinks - also a huge plus in this double room. The room was quiet, with very little sound from surrounding rooms. Thermostat fan stayed on softly, instead of clicking on and off. Great location, tucked in, close to all our show sites. Walked to excellent supper at Murphy's Steakhouse, adjacent to parking lot. Lots of parking closeby. Great indoor pool - perfect temp and size. Hot tub also available. Helpful, friendly staff. Bible in room, open to Psalm 23, with card that they hoped to offer us a home away from home, and asked blessings on our journey. Breakfast buffet practically perfect. Would like more scrambled eggs, sugar-free syrup, and instant oatmeal. Great biscuits and waffles! So glad to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Wonderful Employees”
Reviews.Author: krcooper12
Reviews.Content: Trip June 28th - July 5th, 2010........Myself, my daughter, my brother and my step-mom. We had originally planned a trip to Florida, but due to the oil slick in the Gulf, seems alot of people headed to the Atlantic side and we couldn't find a room. My dad, step-mom and brother had been out to Branson the year before and had a great time, so we decided to go again. I had been to Branson 20 + years ago and I was amazed at the change. The hotel check in took, 5 minutes tops, our room was in the main building, but the distance between buildings wasn't that far, my car is a 03 Impala and you could put two of them end to end between the main building and the building right beside it, and the 3rd buidling is directly in front of the 2nd building separated by 4 employee rooms and the outdoor pool, hot tub and deck. The room (136) was clean and roomy, my only suggestion would be, they need new matresses, I've had 2 neck surgeries and they were a little too soft for me. We never had any issues with cleaning, towels were always plentiful, the fridge/micro were clean, and we never heard any noise from the inside hallway. The outdoor pool/hot tub were very clean. We didn't use the indoor facilities as it was in the 90's. We walked to just about everything we did. Getting out on 76 can be trying, but I never had any major issues going out of or into the parking lot. My daughter went down every morning for the donuts........she loved them. Air conditioning worked great, the bath room was clean, they have shampoo and body wash in the showers, it isn't too bad, but we always take our own. A trip to Branson Landing is a must and the Tangers Outlet mall down the road is also nice. The Hollywood Wax museum, House of Mirrors and the Castle of Chaos are great, the Belgium Waffle House across the street is a must for anyone who wants wonderful home cooked food.....it is absolutely wonderful. The Plantation resturant down 76 toward Table Rock Lake is a great buffet, Andy's frozen custard shop is a must......be prepared, the line is always very long.........if there is no line, they are out of custard, go back later. Branson is a great overall location for the family, but if you intend to go to alot of the shows/dinner shows.....be prepared to fork over big bucks...........for the four of us most of the shows/attractions we did were in the neighborhood of $25.00 - $35.00 per person, and these were not dinner shows, so it didn't include food.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: ivawms
Reviews.Content: We often stay in Branson, but this was our first stay at the Best Western Center Pointe Inn. Being so close to some major attractions, we wondered about the ease of getting in and out of this location. It was actually quite easy and close to every place we planned to visit on this trip. This was the quietest room we have had in Branson. It was so wonderful to sleep in and not hear even one person going down the hall on their departure. We know our floor was completely full and we were so pleased to sleep in the next morning. I am sure many guests took advantage of the breakfast, but no noise in our hallway. The room was very neat and clean. Large enough to relax and enjoy our stay. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The indoor pool was beautiful, and we saw several enjoying the outdoor pool as well. Ladies will love the many mirrors placed just right in the room for hair and makeup. The staff was helpful and very friendly. This was a completely enjoyable stay in our favorite vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is centrally located in Branson and has great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: BransonTraveler18
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Center Pointe Inn in Branson, Missouri is centrally located to the attractions and is a great value for the money. The staff is courteous and the rooms are quiet and clean. A continental breakfast is included in the price. The Inn has both an indoor and outdoor pool and wireless connection to the internet. Many attractions, restaurants, and souvenir shops are within walking distance. The Inn also has a ticket outlet that makes getting tickets for the shows and other attractions painless.

Reviews.Title: “My Mom Didn't Complain About A Thing!”
Reviews.Author: JackalopeCraig
Reviews.Content: My parents were on a cross-country drive to visit me and my wife and I was startled to hear only good things about their stay at this property. I mention this because it is quite rare for my mom not to find fault with something - especially at a restaurant or hotel. So, take my word for it, if my mom can't find something to complain about - it rarely happens - then you can rest assured the Center Pointe In will exceed your expectations as well. Nice property, good value and great customer care.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, but confirm location of room”
Reviews.Author: roomchecker
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Branson for a vacation. Booked this motel online. Unfortunately, it was not as expected. The rooms were clean, ample space, but there are 3 BUILDINGS. We had planned to spend quite a bit of time at the pool and hot tub, but they were in a different building, as well as the breakfast area. The idea of walking across the parking lot wasn't what we had in mind to enjoy the ameneties. The breakfast was excellent, with a good variety. We did not use the pool, as we stayed only 1 night instead of the 4 nights as previously planned. The front staff could not find us anything else in the main building, so we checked out and went to another BestWestern in the area. If you stay at this location, call directly, and confirm a room in the MAIN BUILDING.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with a good price”
Reviews.Author: lrat1941
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and neat and it was very quiet. The breakfast was much more than I had expected! I would probably stay there again. Thanks for the good stay.

Reviews.Title: “At my service.”
Reviews.Author: lst317
Reviews.Content: It is in a very convenient location and reasonably priced. Bring your swimming suits and enjoy the nice pool and hot tub. The staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: beth_callihan
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel whenever our previous reservations at another hotel became a nightmare and we had to find a different place to stay. Best Western Center Pointe Inn is a great value and the service is amazing. Infact whenever we booked our room we told them of the horrible experience we had at the other hotel and told her that the cheap prices at the other hotel definately didn't make up for their sleeping conditions. The front desk worker asked how much we had to pay for a room at the other hotel and she actually averaged the price for us so that our stay at the Best Western was cheaper than what they normally would charge because "They wanted our stay in Branson to be the best possible". The rooms were very nice and the beds were the best hotel beds I have ever slept on. The breakfast was nice too (alot of choices) and the pools were clean and well kept. I will definately be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here instead of Waterpark - still enjoyed Waterpark and enjoyed the Beds and Breakfast at BW”
Reviews.Author: Leah C
Reviews.Content: We love going to the Castle Rock Waterpark on Green Valley but HATE sleeping there as the beds are horrible. That resort also does not have breakfast, so we stay at Best Western. Both places have FREE parking, so that doesn't cost us. We get to sleep in a nice room with comfortable beds, have breakfast then drive to the Waterpark and pay $12 per person to use the waterpark instead of $110 a night to sleep there and be in pain.

Reviews.Title: “We had a pleasent experience.”
Reviews.Author: missouridptraveler
Reviews.Content: The facility was clean and very well staffed. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: dandm3829
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, next to the Titantic. You can walk to many attractions and shows from here. It has a very nice continental breakfast, very friendly staff, and very clean and nice rooms. There is a indoor pool and a sauna. We will definitely stay here the next time we go to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nurseaggie
Reviews.Content: we decided to stay here on our second trip back thru branson. the front staff were extremely pleasant. they honored (without question) our AARP discount and gave us a good rate. we did not eat the hot breakfast (slept late). the room does have an older outdated feel to is and smelled musty, but was clean and had comfortable beds. great location for access to local shows. would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised by this motel”
Reviews.Author: rpger
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this motel. The beds were very comfortable, the continental breakfast was better than most, the hot tub actually worked and the pool was open. The location was convenient to all the attractions

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Cruise,J.D.
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Branson Friday night, December 12th, and went to our hotel, the Best Western Center Pointe Inn. I was traveling with my wife and 1.5 year old son. We stayed at this hotel last year, and again we had a good experience. They did forget to put a crib in our room the first night, but it was quickly taken care of when we requested one. They also honored our request for a first floor room. The deluxe continental breakfast is very good, and the indoor pool and hot tub are very nice. We had the pool and hot tub to ourselves on Sunday night. There is a small exercise room and I used the treadmill. Our room was clean, the internet worked great, and the shower had plenty of hot water and water pressure. The hotel is in a good location and I can recommend it without reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: gimili
Reviews.Content: We had booked a different hotel for our vacation but only stayed a few days as we were not impressed. We thought we would try the CPI for the rest of of vacation and what a pick it was. It cost maybe $25 a night more than the previous hotel but was worth every penny. Although they were doing work on the exterior, it never bothered us at all. We had gotten a king bed and what a treat. It was spacious and clean. There was a fridge and microwave. The bed had 5 pillows and was very comfy. Fantastic indoor pool and hot tub. They had a continental breakfast and there were a lot of items This may sound small but the staff in the breakfast area did a fantastic job. They kept the food stocked and the tables clean. The hotel was on the main drag so you were a lot closer to the attractions This wil be the hotel we stay in next time we come to Branson

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend July Fourth!”
Reviews.Author: Aortus
Reviews.Content: Outstanding value! Clean, quiet, comfortable - and the location is excellent. It is literally right next to the Titanic Museum, and just across the street from the Legends Theater. Restaurants and shopping (and a drugstore, too) are within walking distance. Montana Mike's Steakhouse also shares the hotel's parking lot, but I advise going there only if convenience is your major priority. The Belgian Waffle House, across the street, is a wonderful place to eat breakfast. My big sister and I will definitely stay there again the next time we raid Branson! -Mrs. Aortus

Reviews.Title: “Good Beds and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Donna W
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 night stay at the Best Western Center Point Inn. Good location. We walked to the Starlite Theater to see the Liverpool Legends which were awesome, and across the street is the theatre with the Legends. The beds were very comfortable and what was great was the four pillows on each bed!! Also two desk type chairs instead of only one like many hotels. Room also had a small refrigerator and microwave which both came in handy. Nice buffet breakfast - choices enough for everyone. One problem we noted was the housekeeping. Our beds were made each day and clean towels, but not clean sheets and a few spills or shoe prints on the bathroom floor were not wiped off. Also rugs needed cleaning, but I always wore my flip-flops. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for the money!”
Reviews.Author: TxTraveler903
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days in mid July. I researched many hotels on the internet and chose this hotel because it was of moderate price and had both an indoor and outdoor pool. My husband, myself, and 2 daughters (ages 2 & 5) stayed in a double queen room. The hotel was very clean and the indoor pool area was perfect for our daughters. The beds were also extremely comfortable. In fact, we slept in all 3 days we were there...something that never happpens at home. The staff was friendly, and the ticket booking service in the gift shop was a great help. The hotel was also very convenient to most all attractions. I was very pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to anyone who wants a clean, nice place to stay at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room and Comfy Bed”
Reviews.Author: TulsaTina
Reviews.Content: I reserved a block of rooms months in advance and made several changes to the reservation. When we arrived, the rooms were on the first floor, as requested. They were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The continental breakfast was well-stocked and had lots of options, including waffles, donuts, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, etc. The grounds were well-maintained and the location was convenient for shopping, restaurants, shows. Somehow a glitch in their system put a hold on my debit card, which they were never able to figure out so be sure to use a credit card instead of debit when booking, We will likely return next year to his hotel. A family reunion was going on with 55 members there at the time we were. They congregated around the pools and breakfast area, etc. This is a terrific location for a big family reunion because of so many common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: vshults
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Center Pointe Inn in Branson, Missouri. The location was great. The attractions in Branson are so widespread you will most likely have to use your car some during your stay. We were able to park right at our front door, and finding parking was no problem either at the hotel or anywhere in Branson. The Best Western is located adjacent to the Titanic Museum. The room was huge, had a great view, and a wonderful jacuzzi bathtub. This room was the best bargain on our trip! At the end of each evening, we headed to the hotel's indoor heated pool and hot tub to relax our aching feet and legs! This was a perfect place to stay in Branson.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again! Clean, close, friendly!”
Reviews.Author: AdaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Due to the bad publicity from my hometown Best Western, I'd never stayed in one in another city. I had gift cards, so I thought I'd stay here. It was very close to many attractions. The breakfast was great - buscuits & gravy, eggs, toasts, waffles, cereals, juice. We only used the indoor pool & it was great. The rooms were very clean. The bedspread was a solid color which I liked b/c it would have shown any stains. Housekeeping was great. The ONLY complaint I have is that my husband could never get on the WiFi, but I think that's b/c we were in 104 which is far away from the office.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Getaway Spot”
Reviews.Author: clay1009
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel numerous times. Has a game room with pool table. Rooms are very clean and nice. Always look forward to our visit with this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: bob63304
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Right in the heart of Branson. The rooms are clean however the you can hear right through the walls. This has been the noisiest hotel I have stayed in. If it wasn't the people doing whatever upstairs it was the TV in the room next to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best Westerntanstic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LUVGOD2
Reviews.Content: AWESOME LOCATION! AWESOME STAFF! The breakfast were great. ALOT OF SELECTIONS! No eggs or bacon but plenty to fill your tummy for your morning start. The staffs were great, because when I checked in the room. Our A/C were not working well and it was kinda warm during July. I informed the front desk and they replace the entire A/C within a hour after I check in. They were so nice!!. Great location and right in the middle of Hwy 76 strips. The pools is nice and it indoor. Not very large as I hoped but enough to cool off during the hot summer month. I RECOMMENDED to anyone to stay there. It right next to Titanic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernSweetieSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Center Pointe Inn for 4 nights. The location was wonderful. We were able to walk to several activities. We stayed in a family suite which was roomy. The tub was alittle narrow but had spa jets. Great surprise after walking all day. The room always smelled good even though they could have vacuumed alittle better. There were sunflower seeds from the previous customer between the night stand and bed for the whole stay. The free breakfast was wonderful, it even had waffles, this saved us alot of time and money. All of the employees were very nice and helpful. We would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Center Pointe Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3215 West Highway 76, Branson, MO 65616-3551
